channel.title: [3000+ Dwnlds] iPanel V2 - Delta & Devolution Versions! [Download & Mini TuT]
channel.description:
[size=36pt]Download Tool: http://www.mediafire.com/?w2migo2nwow[/size]
[img]http://img148.imageshack.us/img148/1179/virusy.png[/img]
[SIZE=5pt]Credits within the class file[/Size]
[SIZE=17pt][FONT=Microsoft Sans Serif]iPanel[COLOR=Red][B]V[/B]2[/COLOR][/FONT][/SIZE][img]http://wildrosesites.com/best-web-design-websites-graphics-rates/blue-flag.png[/img] [size=8pt]Please post if you've added this or like it![/size]
[B][FONT=Century Gothic]T[/FONT][/B]his is the second version of iPanel. By the way, I'll update this tutorial if another update is required. Many differences and updates have occurred from the original release, such as more buttons and more tabs. I'll continue to update and perhaps you can find some things to fix on, or work on. I've included more pictures. Perhaps, if someone is kind enough to convert some of the methods to Deltascape or other sources as this will only work in Devolution or Dodian sources at the moment. Although, it's not that hard to fix them all, maybe a 5 minute job. Anyways, have fun with this.
For the features list, click [iurl=#f][b]here.[/b][/iurl]
[b]Version Three Sneak Peak:[/b] http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=dxer9v&s=5
And of course, you'll need some pictures. By the way just a reminder that the download above is for Devolution sources. If you wish to download a Deltascape version, then select the correct one.
[img]http://g.imagehost.org/0419/1_36.jpg[/img]
[img]http://g.imagehost.org/0487/2_21.jpg[/img]
[img]http://g.imagehost.org/0670/3_14.jpg[/img]
[img]http://g.imagehost.org/0969/4_9.jpg[/img]
[img]http://g.imagehost.org/0766/5_7.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img36.imageshack.us/img36/3845/74336944.png[/img]
[size=14pt]Procedure[/size]
Everything below here will involve editing of the [i]server class[/i].
Please note, these go into different places and you should know where these go, if not post.
[code] public static ControlPanel controlPanel = null; [/code]
[code] controlPanel = new ControlPanel(); [/code]
Now, close the server class and go into your [i]client class[/i]. Once you are in there, search for this method:
[code] public void destruct() { [/code]
And in that method, right below that try statement, add the following statement:
[code] server.controlPanel.removeListModelItem(playerName); [/code]
Next on our list, search for this method in the client class:
[code] public void initialize() { [/code]
Below that, add this:
[code] server.controlPanel.addListModelItem(playerName); [/code]
Now in the client class, under your logout method, add this: (By the way, it's usually called [i]logout[/i])
[code] server.controlPanel.removeListModelItem(playerName); [/code]
Now, it's important that you compile right now. If you've got a missing method, then you should add this:
[size=11pt][b]Devolution:[/b][/size]
[code] public void gfx(int id1) { stillgfx(id1, absY, absX, 0, 0); } [/code] [size=11pt][b]Deltascape:[/b][/size]
[code] public void gfx(int id1) { stillgfx(id1, absY, absX); } [/code]
Now, wasn't that hard? I doubt it and if you have any errors please post them.
[anchor=f]Features:[/anchor] [quote] - Fast Performance - 20 Buttons - Specialized Dialogue - Opens upon initialization of server - User friendly interfaces - Auto Updating Players Table

item.title: [3000+ Dwnlds] iPanel V2 - Delta & Devolution Versions! [Download & Mini TuT]
item.dc:creator: @xbritvax xbritvax
item.description:
@xbritvax wrote:

[size=36pt]Download Tool: http://www.mediafire.com/?w2migo2nwow[/size]

[SIZE=5pt]Credits within the class file[/Size]

[SIZE=17pt][FONT=Microsoft Sans Serif]iPanel[COLOR=Red]V2[/COLOR][/FONT][/SIZE]
[size=8pt]Please post if you’ve added this or like it![/size]

[FONT=Century Gothic]T[/FONT]his is the second version of iPanel. By the way, I’ll update this tutorial if another update is required. Many differences and updates have occurred from the original release, such as more buttons and more tabs. I’ll continue to update and perhaps you can find some things to fix on, or work on. I’ve included more pictures. Perhaps, if someone is kind enough to convert some of the methods to Deltascape or other sources as this will only work in Devolution or Dodian sources at the moment. Although, it’s not that hard to fix them all, maybe a 5 minute job. Anyways, have fun with this.

For the features list, click [iurl=#f]here.[/iurl]

Version Three Sneak Peak: http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=dxer9v&s=5

And of course, you’ll need some pictures. By the way just a reminder that the download above is for Devolution sources. If you wish to download a Deltascape version, then select the correct one.

[size=14pt]Procedure[/size]

Everything below here will involve editing of the server class.

Please note, these go into different places and you should know where these go, if not post.

public static ControlPanel controlPanel = null;
controlPanel = new ControlPanel();

Now, close the server class and go into your client class. Once you are in there, search for this method:

public void destruct() {

And in that method, right below that try statement, add the following statement:

server.controlPanel.removeListModelItem(playerName);

Next on our list, search for this method in the client class:

public void initialize() {

Below that, add this:

server.controlPanel.addListModelItem(playerName);

Now in the client class, under your logout method, add this: (By the way, it’s usually called logout)

server.controlPanel.removeListModelItem(playerName);

Now, it’s important that you compile right now. If you’ve got a missing method, then you should add this:

[size=11pt]Devolution:[/size]

    public void gfx(int id1) {
        stillgfx(id1, absY, absX, 0, 0);
    }

[size=11pt]Deltascape:[/size]

    public void gfx(int id1) {
        stillgfx(id1, absY, absX);
    }

Now, wasn’t that hard? I doubt it and if you have any errors please post them.

[anchor=f]Features:[/anchor]

[quote]

  • Fast Performance
  • 20 Buttons
  • Specialized Dialogue
  • Opens upon initialization of server
  • User friendly interfaces
  • Auto Updating Players Table

Read full topic
